22-030HR.summary: Recommendation to approve minutes for the Equity and Human Relations Commission Regular Meeting of Wednesday, September 7, 2022.A motion was made by Commissioner Schultz, seconded by Commissioner Lara, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 9 - Sharifa Batts, Robbie Butler, Christopher Covington, Zuleimy Delgadillo, Lissette Flores, Keyona Montgomery, Eduardo Lara, Jon Schultz and Alyssa GutierrezAbstain: 1 - Cory AllenAbsent: 4 - Trace Camacho, Zoe Nicholson, Chanel Smith and Amy EriksenPUBLIC COMMENTChair Gutierrez spoke.No members of the public addressed the Commission.CHAIR REMARKSChair Gutierrez provided opening remarks.OFFICE OF EQUITY REMARKSAlanah Grant, Racial Equity Leadership Development Specialist, spoke. Chair Gutierrez spoke. A dialogue ensued between Chair Gutierrez and Alanah Grant, Racial Equity Leadership Development Specialist.Commissioner Covington spoke. Chair Gutierrez spoke. Page 2 of 7TELECONFERENCE, 6:00 PMWEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 5, 2022CITY OF LONG BEACHEQUITY AND HUMAN RELATIONS COMMISSION MINUTESCommissioner Delgadillo spoke. COMMISSIONER UPDATESChair Gutierrez spoke. Commissioner Covington spoke. A discussion ensued between Chair Gutierrez and Commissioner Covington. Commissioner Lara spoke. NEW BUSINESS2.

22-031HR.summary: Recommendation to receive and file a presentation from Gay Elder Circle on the intersectional needs and experiences of LGBTQ+ Older Adults in Long Beach.Chair Gutierrez spoke.Tony Viramontes, Equity & Community Engagement Program Specialist, spoke.A dialogue ensued between Chair Gutierrez and Tony Viramontes, Equity & Community Engagement Program Specialist.Bill Sive, Gay Elder Circle, spoke; and provided a presentation.Chair Gutierrez spoke.Bill Sive, Gay Elder Circle, spoke.Commissioner Lara spoke.Commissioner Allen spoke.Bill Sive, Gay Elder Circle, spoke.Page 3 of 7TELECONFERENCE, 6:00 PMWEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 5, 2022CITY OF LONG BEACHEQUITY AND HUMAN RELATIONS COMMISSION MINUTESChair Gutierrez spoke.A motion was made by Commissioner Covington, seconded by Commissioner Lara, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 9 - Cory Allen, Sharifa Batts, Christopher Covington, Zuleimy Delgadillo, Lissette Flores, Keyona Montgomery, Eduardo Lara, Jon Schultz and Alyssa GutierrezAbsent: 5 - Robbie Butler, Trace Camacho, Zoe Nicholson, Chanel Smith and Amy Eriksen3.

22-032HR.summary: Recommendation to receive and file a presentation from the Long Beach Gray Panthers on Older Adult issues in social and economic justice.Chair Gutierrez spoke.Tony Viramontes, Equity & Community Engagement Program Specialist, spoke. A dialogue ensued between Chair Gutierrez and Tony Viramontes, Equity & Community Engagement Program Specialist.Karen Reside, Long Beach Gray Panthers, spoke; and provided a PowerPoint presentation. Chair Gutierrez spoke.A dialogue ensued between Chair Gutierrez and Karen Reside, Long Beach Gray Panthers.Commissioner Flores spoke. Commissioner Lara spoke. Karen Reside, Long Beach Gray Panthers, spoke.Chair Gutierrez spoke.Page 4 of 7TELECONFERENCE, 6:00 PMWEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 5, 2022CITY OF LONG BEACHEQUITY AND HUMAN RELATIONS COMMISSION MINUTESCommissioner Batts spoke.Chair Gutierrez spoke.Commissioner Allen spoke. Karen Reside, Long Beach Gray Panthers, spoke.Commissioner Covington spoke. Karen Reside, Long Beach Gray Panthers, spoke.Chair Gutierrez spoke. Commissioner Schultz spoke.A dialogue ensued between Chair Gutierrez and Commissioner Schultz.Karen Reside, Long Beach Gray Panthers, spoke.Alanah Grant, Racial Equity Leadership Development Specialist, spoke. Chair Gutierrez spoke.A motion was made by Commissioner Allen, seconded by Commissioner Flores, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 10 - Cory Allen, Sharifa Batts, Robbie Butler, Christopher Covington, Zuleimy Delgadillo, Lissette Flores, Keyona Montgomery, Eduardo Lara, Jon Schultz and Alyssa GutierrezAbsent: 4 - Trace Camacho, Zoe Nicholson, Chanel Smith and Amy Eriksen4.
